modName: UNP Armature and Animations resource for Blender users
summary:
Modders resource for Blender users who would like to create mods for UNP Body.
The body is placed in the correct vanilla position and it is properly aligned with feet and hands.
This upload includes:
Basic Blend files with Armature and UNP Base/skinny bodies.
Basic Skyrim animation files with UNP Base/skinny bodies.
descriptionHtml:
Description:
==========
This is a very simple resource I made mostly for myself, because it is just handy to keep it always available on Nexus, but I will be happy if it is of help to anybody else out there.
The thing that really bugged me about UNP is when you import UNP body into Blender it never ends up in the right position where Vanilla body would be, so I fixed it, put the body to be in the correct vanilla position and now it is properly aligned with feet and hands.
I also added UNP body to the animation chain Blend file by Growlf. It is an invaluable resource for weightpainting for your new or imported meshes in Blender. Please check out his original version with CBBE body: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/16332/?]TES5 Blender Animation Chain by [b]Growlf[/b][/url]


This File includes:
===============
Basic armature and animation blend files with UNP Base or UNP Skinny body.
Every file Includes  UNP body versions _0 and _1, UNP hands and feet, head and female skeleton.

How to install Blender for Skyrim:
==============================
 
1. Start by installing Python: [url=http://www.python.org/ftp/python/2.6.6/python-2.6.6.msi]http://www.python.org/ftp/python/2.6.6/python-2.6.6.msi
[/url]
2. Then you must install PYFFi first [url=http://sourceforge.net/projects/pyffi/files/pyffi/2.1.10]http://sourceforge.net/projects/pyffi/files/pyffi/2.1.10
[/url]
3. And only then Blender 2.49b: [url=http://www.blender.org/development/release-logs/blender-249]http://www.blender.org/development/release-logs/blender-249
[/url]
4. Get the niftools: [url=http://sourceforge.net/projects/niftools/files/blender_nif_scripts/2.5.x/2.5.09/]http://sourceforge.net/projects/niftools/files/blender_nif_scripts/2.5.x/2.5.09/
[/url]
5. And get the latest nifskope as well: [url=http://sourceforge.net/projects/niftools/files/nifskope/1.1.3/]http://sourceforge.net/projects/niftools/files/nifskope/1.1.3/[/url]


Load one of the basic files and import the armor you would like to modify or create a new armor.

If you need help, please don't PM me, but better check out the following tutorials:

[url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Skyrim_common_mod_issues]Skyrim common mod issues[/url]

[url=https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Blender_3D:_Noob_to_Pro]Blender 3D: Noob to Pro[/url] 

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3790/?]Blender NIF Import - Export Tutorial by XunAmarox and 2pac4eva7[/url]

SydneyB tutorials:
[url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Creating_an_armour_for_Skyrim._Part_1]Creating an armour for Skyrim: Part 1[/url] and [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Creating_an_armour_for_Skyrim._Part_2]Part 2[/url];

[url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/Converting_an_armour_to_another_body_for_Skyrim]Converting an armour to another body for Skyrim[/url]

BB Drac tutorials:
[url=http://www.birrabrothers.com/drac/index.php?dsps=206]Creating a new armor (body) for Skyrim[/url]

Hanaisse tutorial series:
[url=http://tesalliance.org/forums/index.php?/topic/5639-creating-skyrim-armor-in-blender-tutorial-series/]Creating Skyrim Armor in Blender Tutorial Series[/url]

How to use animations files:
========================

Please refer to the original instructions by Growlf  [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/16332/?]TES5 Blender Animation Chain by [b]Growlf[/b][/url]
